result.execSummary:
The defendant Sherrod D Fowler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 20 days sentence credit.

superMiscConds.notes:
Cash bail applied to BUY MONEY - PAID IN FULL.  Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
Social Security benefits will meet the element of employment if defendant is receiving the benefits.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

No contact with Confidential Informant (R. B.).
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

supervisions.notes:
If revoked:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Consecutive to: Count 1, if revoked.
Same Conditions for Extended Supervision apply as to Conditions for Probation, if revoked.

Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: May 23, 2016 Sentencing hearing filed by Linda Coleman, court reporter.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Character reference letter filed in court by Atty Tishberg.

Defendant Sherrod D Fowler in court, in custody, with attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg.   Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant previously found guilty by jury of both counts. 
Defendant's sister, Tacarra Ivy, presentened statements to the court.
Defendant's mother, Constance Ivy, presented statments to the court.

The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

Count 1

IMPOSED PRISON SENTENCE of: 

10 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 20 days - Count 1 only)
  -  6 YEAR(S) OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  4 YEAR(S) OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

Count 2

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE of: 

10 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 0 days) - CONSECUTIVE TO COUNT 1
  -  6 YEAR(S) OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  4 YEAR(S) OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

STAYED FOR 5 YEARS PROBATION (COUNT 2 ONLY) CONSECUTIVE TO COUNT 1

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION FOR COUNTS 1 AND 2:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling - Social Security benefits will meet the element of employment if defendant receiving benefit.
*No contact with:  Confidential Informant, R.B.
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.

RESTITUTION:  $320.00 Buy money - Apply cash bail to restitution only, balance of posted money to be returned to poster. 

COURT COSTS:  $268.00 EACH COUNT to be paid as a condition of extended supervision;

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 EACH COUNT to be paid as a condition of extended supervision;

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Cover letter dated May 20, 2016 filed Atty Tishberg with attached letters from family members and friend.

Day Two:
Continued from: 05/03/16
Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Sherrod D Fowler in court, in custody, with attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg.   

Court back on the record @ 9:05 am.
Court addressed the order of jury instructions with the parties.
Juror returned to the courtroom @ 9:10 am.

State presented closing arguments.
Defense presented closing arguments.
State presented rebuttal.

Court read the jury instructions and verdict.
Bailiff sworn in @  9:59 am.
Jurors excused for deliberations @ 10:00 am.

Court addressed the exhibits with the parties if requested by the jurors.
All of the paper exhibits will be allow back with the jurors if requested.

Court in adjournment @ 10:01 am.

Jurors notified the bailiff they had a verdict @ 10:25 am.
Court back on the record @ 10:35 am.
Jurors returned to the courtroom @ 10:37 am.

Court reads the verdicts.
As to count 1:  GUILTY
As to count 2:  GUILTY
Defense requests the jurors be polled.
Clerk polls the jurors.
State moves for receipt of the verdict.
Court receives the verdict and enters judgment on both counts.

Jurors excused @ 10:41 am.

Matter put over for setencing.
State requests bail be revoked.
Defense objects and presented arguments.
Court revokes bail pending sentencing.
Defendant to be held in custody pending sentencing.
Defendant remanded to the custody of the Waukesha County Sheriff's Department.

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 11:30 am.

Biological material collected in connection with the action shall be disposed of pursuant to the retention period for exhibits in section 757.54, Wis. Stats.

State rests.

Court also addressed the exhibits with the parties.

Court in adjournment @ 4:45 pm.

Hearing on October 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Lesli S Boese appeared for State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg appeared by phone means for Defendant Sherrod D Fowler.  
Defendant Sherrod D Fowler in court.
ORAL RULING ON:  Defendant's Motion for Disclosure of the Confidential Informant.

Court finds/orders the following:  Reasons placed on the record.
Court finds the Defense has not made a sufficient showing.
Therefore, Court denies - Defense request for the disclosure of the CI.
However, if the State will be calling the CI as a witness at trial,  the court will require the State disclose CI's name and what they will be testifying to be provided to the Defense 60 day prior to trial.

Hearing scheduled for October 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
